page.title: 06Landscape - The Promenade
page.content: The {Promenade }is one of the main attractions of Silloth. It runs from near the docks almost two miles North to Skinburness. The Green lies between it and the town. At the Silloth end is the{Lifeboat Station, }which is run by volunteers. The inshore lifeboat is an inflatable craft which can travel very quickly over the water. Near the Skinburness end is a crumbling old 'pill-box', a relic of the second World War. The Promenade and{Sea-wall act as defences against the sea and erosion. Heavy timber break-waters project out into the sea at regular intervals. Much of the Promenade had to be rebuilt as recently as 1981 as running repairs were insufficient. Now steps run down from the top to the beach. Locals and visitors alike love to walk along the Promenade looking across the Solway to Scotland.
